Saturday, February 15, 2020 at 8:45 AM until 2:00 PM

We are so excited to have you on campus for our Accepted Student Day! Whether it's your first visit to E-town or your tenth, we can't wait to show you what it means to be a Blue Jay. Come learn more about the academic programs from the faculty who will become your mentors, the clubs and activities from the students who will become your friends, and the sense of community from everyone on campus.
*Accepted Student Day is intended for students who have already received an offer of admission to Elizabethtown College. If you have not been accepted yet, please consider
(please use the email with which you applied)
By providing your mobile phone number, you agree to receive text messages from Elizabethtown College.
How many guests will you be bringing with you?

Elizabethtown College does not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, color, religion, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, genetic information, possession of a general education development certificate as compared to a high school diploma, or any other legally protected status. This commitment applies but is not limited to decisions made with respect to hiring and promotion, the administration educational programs and policies, scholarship and loan programs, and athletic or other College administered programs. Discrimination or harassment of any kind is strictly forbidden.

Elizabethtown College Annual Security and Fire Safety Report 2019 (Clery Report)
Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act

, is a federal law that requires colleges and universities to disclose certain timely and annual information about campus crime and security policies. All public and private institutions of post secondary education participating in federal student aid programs are subject to it.

The Clery Act was signed into law in 1990 as the Crime Awareness and Campus Security Act of 1990. Amendments to the Act in 1998 renamed it in memory of Jeanne Clery, who was murdered at Lehigh University in 1986. The law
was supported by Jeanne's parents, Howard & Connie Clery, who
also founded the non-profit Security On Campus, Inc. in 1987, which is now known as the
Annual Security and Fire Safety Report

Each institution of higher education in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania is required to annually publish specific data relating to the number per capita rate of certain types of crime reported to have occurred at the institution, and the security measures that are in place to reduce the risk of criminal victimization for members of the community. Additionally, this report addresses requirements of the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Act. Elizabethtown College's Clery Committee meets periodically throughout the summer and early fall to review appropriate resources from the Clery Center, develop an outline for the report and evaluate and revise report content as needed and publish the report no later than October 1.

Campus Security maintains a combined Daily Crime Log and Fire Log of all crimes, fire-related incidents, and other serious incidents that occur on campus and have been reported to Elizabethtown College Department of Campus Security. The daily crime and fire log includes the date and time the report was received, the date and time the incident occurred, the nature of the offense, the location of the offense and disposition if available. The log can be viewed at the Campus Security Office during regular business hours (8am-5pm Monday through Friday, except Holidays), 605 South Mount Joy Street or anytime online by
Megan's Law: Information on Registered Sex Offenders

Pennsylvania's Megan's Law, 42 Pa.C.S. 9799.1, requires the State Police to create and maintain a registry of persons who reside, work, carry on a vocation, or attend school in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and who have either been convicted of, entered a plea of guilty to, or adjudicated delinquent of certain sexual offenses in Pennsylvania or another jurisdiction.  Additionally, the Pennsylvania State Police is required to make certain information on registered sex offenders available to the public. This information can be obtaining by visiting the Megan's Law

Transfer now for the Spring 2020 semester!
Study in our Physician Assistant program at Elizabethtown College. Through our innovative, hands-on approach you’ll learn how to:
Gain real-world experience as a first-assistant in the Operating Room
Make rounds in medical and surgical fields

We offer two entry options including a combined BS/MS degree over five and a half years or a standalone master’s degree over 25 months for students with a bachelor’s degree from E-town or another institution. Earn your MS in
Complete undergraduate coursework in 3.5 years (BS Biology/Allied Health).
Learn about our Physician Assistant Degree Program
Become an Occupational Therapist in 5 years with our combined Bachelor of Science in Health Science and Master of Science in Occupational Therapy. You will:
Begin your OT coursework from your first year on campus, preparing you for your career from day one
Complete six months of clinical fieldwork ahead of taking your Board Certification at the end of your fifth year
Have the option to pursue a doctoral degree in Occupational Therapy (OTD) following the completion of your MS studies
Learn about our Occupational Therapy Degree Program
Start and finish your OT education at E-town with our 3 2 and 3 3 degree options, without needing to reapply for your graduate studies.
The Neuroscience major at Elizabethtown College is an interdisciplinary program that provides you with a deep understanding of how the brain works and how it impacts human behavior. You will:
Complete hands-on laboratory research with a faculty member from your first year
Take classes in molecular, behavioral, cognitive and clinical neuroscience
Gain a deeper understanding of neurological, developmental and psychiatric disorders
Learn about our Neuroscience Degree Program
You’ll study integrated courses in Biology, Psychology, Chemistry and Computer Science and be fully prepared for a career in a clinical laboratory or to continue your education at graduate school.
Our Data Science major focuses on the organization, storage and analysis of “Big Data.” Join a rapidly growing industry and prepare for your career through:
Real-world learning experiences with local businesses and non-profit organizations
Integrated courses in Computer Science, Mathematics and Statistics
The option to add complementary studies to your program with a second major or minor in Biology, Business, or Communications
Learn about our Data Science Degree Program
Many of our students have gone on to graduate programs or work as data analysts and statisticians around the country.
Pursue a career at the cutting-edge of medical technology with a degree in Biomedical Engineering from Elizabethtown College. Our ABET-accredited Engineering program will:
Equip you with the design and technical skills to advance the medical device industry
Help you to improve the quality of life of patients with a variety of medical conditions
Solve problems and advance in a lucrative and growing field
Learn about our Biomedical Engineering Degree Program
Find out why we’ve been awarded a Colleges of Distinction honor for the past three years and join us in the Department of Engineering.
are employed and/or in graduate school within one year of graduating
had at least one faculty member who made them excited about learning, nearly double the rate of peer institutions
were “satisfied” to “very satisfied” with their overall graduate program experience
completed their accelerated undergraduate degree in one to three years

Many of our students say they knew that E-town was the school for them as soon as they set foot on campus. Get to know us and our Blue Jay community in person!
